content: I've tried merging #9561, but I get an error that it does not know "PMF", while the relevant imports and structure of Probability/Distributions/Geometric are identical to those for Probability/Distributions/Poisson, which did merge a few days ago. I'm a bit confused by this. I'll try to fix it in a bit, but my visual-studio code is stuck as I have a little Git merge problem on another branch (https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113489-new-members/topic/Git.20merge.20problem/near/413121779). I guess the obvious fix would be e.g. importing Probability/ProbabilityMassFunction/Basic, but it feels a bit weird that that would be necessary for this file, while it wasn't necessary for the Poisson distribution... (I can't really imagine that any of the other imports of the Poisson distribution would require something that imports the PMF...)

Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Probability.Distributions.Poisson does import Probability.ProbabilityMassFunction.Basic? https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/25e096f22cdeb3a31783a1a65fece51857b301dd/Mathlib/Probability/Distributions/Poisson.lean#L10

I'm sorry, you're right. I checked the file on a branch that I had open, where it wasn't present (which is the branch I messed up with Git stuff, so probably something weird happened?). Anyway, I'll add the line directly via Github and re-run. I'll send it back to Bors if it builds.
Josha Dekker has marked this topic as resolved.

FWIW, there the header of ../Poisson.lean looked like

/-
Copyright (c) 2024 Josha Dekker. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Josha Dekker
-/

import Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.Exponential
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Exponential
import Mathlib.Probability.Notation

/-! # Poisson distributions over ℕ

Define the Poisson measure over the natural numbers

## Main definitions
* `poissonPmfReal`: the function `λ n ↦ exp (- λ) * λ ^ n / n!`
  for `n ∈ ℕ`, which is the probability density function of a Poisson distribution with
  rate `λ > 0`.
* `poissonPmf`: `ℝ≥0∞`-valued pdf,
  `poissonPmf λ = ENNReal.ofReal (poissonPmfReal λ)`.
* `poissonMeasure`: a Poisson measure on `ℕ`, parametrized by its rate `λ`.
-/
It worked :tada:
Yury G. Kudryashov has marked this topic as unresolved.
Could you please make a small PR with search&replace Pmf -> PMF everywhere in the new file? Thank you!

I'm not sure if I understand. I think I already did that for the geometric distribution before merging #9561. For the Poisson distribution, this was taken care of in #9681. The above piece of code was from a file on a (messed-up?) branch on my laptop. Probably I somehow had managed to merge an early version of #9465 onto that branch or whatever. Anyway, I think everything should be fine now?
Thank you! I guess, I compared to an old branch on my laptop.
Yury G. Kudryashov has marked this topic as resolved.
